repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
#24646 didn't solve the problem actually. But the incorrect use of `filterText` is corrected. I take a look at #17051 and made some changes to the current `omnifunc` implementation. It works fine now  #17051 and #22803 both fixed. I'm not sure if this is the right way. any advice? Note that this is a **draft**. I don't think part of the code is needed anymore but as a reference for comparison.

![Untitled](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/41671631/6dcc9922-c589-4ec8-84f2-b73943a32557)

comment_data.body: does there still need respect `client.offset_encoding` usually `utf-16`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -669,14 +669,24 @@ local function sort_completion_items(items)
   end)
 end
 
+local function charidx_without_compchar(ltext, col)

comment_regular_data.body: could we move `omnifunc` to a single file ？Increasing function parameters sideways is a bit ugly. Avoid lsp.lua becoming bloated

> could we move omnifunc to a single file ？Increasing function parameters sideways is a bit ugly.

I don't understand this.

> Avoid lsp.lua becoming bloated

Spreading things around in more files cause a different problem. What is "bloated" about a since omnifunc() function in lsp.lua?

If something is bloated, code should be deleted. Spreading it out just hides the problem.

The implementation of filter text and start_col on the previous code will involve file crossing. And it doesn't make sense to put some functions in util i think.  now I add `completion.lua` for `omnifunc` and support `filterText` with fuzzymatch.
test case write later . I would like to know the opinion of other members regarding the current implementation first

> Spreading things around in more files cause a different problem. What is "bloated" about a since omnifunc() function in lsp.lua?
> If something is bloated, code should be deleted. Spreading it out just hides the problem.


I think a lsp/completion.lua would be okayish if we use it to eliminate the existing spread. Instead of:

- lsp.lua
    - omnifunc
- lsp/util.lua
    - extract_completion_items
    - text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items

We could have:

- lsp/completion.lua
    - omnifunc
    - _private_ /local extract_completion_items and text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items
    - future: turn omnifunc sync, add show() for async completion; this could also supports option to e.g. filter candidates to only show snippets
    - future: Add a way to setup CompleteDone event to handle additionalTextEdits + snippets
I am plan to add `vim.lsp.autocompletion` and async document preview ,  need wait #24723 . after #24273 done i will back to this pr.

> private /local extract_completion_items and text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items

wouldn't it make sense to expose those functions somehow so people can use them for e.g. completion plugins?
item needs to pass the filter and fuzzy match check before it will be added to complete. The logic here doesn't apply to plugins. Note that this is an early draft only.

> I am plan to add vim.lsp.autocompletion

Please don't use `autocompletion` but `completion`. Automatic trigger should (if at all) just be one aspect of the functionality, not the main focus.

I mean vim.lsp.autocompletion can be used in on attach if someone need just a simple completion for lsp and word. there will be no changes to the omnifunc it will still exist. does not break the current behavior.  Just to add an ancillary. Because it's easy to implement and doesn't require too much code .  This is just a thought on my part.
